tool_description: Deliver a seamless eSignature experience from your website, CRM, or custom app by integrating the signNow REST API. Simplify the signing and management of documents online, make your teams more productive, and delight customers with intuitive and easy-to-use electronic signatures. Create branded eSignature workflows within your application. eSign and send documents for signature, create reusable templates, share documents and templates via signing links, track the signing status, and more.  T...
name: SignNow
title: SignNow

api_list.name: [Embedded signing] Get role ids
api_list.description:
This endpoint returns details of specific document

The Document object contains:

- Metadata: file name, size, extension, ID;
- Fields, elements (texts, checks and signatures),
- Invites, status of the invites,
- Roles,
- Timestamps (date created, date updated)

Document is a fundamental object of every e-signature operation. It’s impossible to send an invite without selecting or [uploading a document](https://docs.signnow.com/docs/signnow/reference/operations/create-a-document) first. In signNow you can add other objects to the document called [fillable fields](https://docs.signnow.com/docs/signnow/branches/v1.2/reference/operations/update-a-document-document-id-adds-fields-to-a-document). When the document is signed, it can be [downloaded in PDF file format](https://docs.signnow.com/docs/signnow/reference/operations/get-a-document-download). Documents in signNow can be [turned into a template](https://docs.signnow.com/docs/signnow/reference/operations/create-a-template). API also allows you to create [event subscriptions](https://docs.signnow.com/docs/signnow/reference/operations/create-a-api-v-2-event) triggered by a specific document.

test_endpoint.404: Unable to find a route to match the URI: document/{document_id}

api_list.name: Get signing links
api_list.description: The endpoint allows to get all existing signing links and IDs of these signing links.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://signnowapi-signnow.p.rapidapi.com/v2/application/signing-links"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "signnowapi-signnow.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://signnowapi-signnow.p.rapidapi.com/v2/application/signing-links"

headers = {

            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "signnowapi-signnow.p.rapidapi.com"

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Generate a link for embedded invite
api_list.description:
Creates a link for the embedded invite.

Copy the field invite unique ID from the response to `POST /v2/documents/{documentUniqueId}/embedded-invites`. It's in the `id` parameter of every invite object.

```
{
"id": "03XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX",
"email": "signer@emaildomain.com",
"role_id": "33XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX",
"order": 1,
"status": "pending"
}
```

In your request specify: `"auth_method"` - signer authentication method; can be `"password"`, `"email"`, `"other"`, `"none"`, `"link_expiration"` - in how many minutes the link expires, ranges from 15 to 45 minutes.

api_list.name: Create embedded signing invites
api_list.description:
Creates embedded signing invites for a document without sending emails.

Once the invite is created, generate a link for it at `POST v2/documents/{document_id}/embedded-invites/{field_invite_id}/link/`

Before composing your request, make sure that:

- you are the owner of the document that you’d like to have signed
- you are about to create an invite for a document, not a template
- your document contains fields
- your document doesn’t appear on any other invite, pending or signed
- Signer’s emails are unique and don’t exceed 150 characters
- all the roles or role IDs in the document are mentioned in the invite (specifying redundant roles will cause an error).
- the Owner of the document cannot be specified as a Signer.

Parameters `role` and `role_id` can be found in the response from `GET /document/{document_id}`. Specify a role either by `role` (unique role name, e.g. “Signer 1”), `role_id` (unique role identifier), or both. If you’ve chosen to add both, please make sure they correspond.

**Authentification methods for Embedded Invites**

Authentication type: phone Method: sms `sms_message` parameter must contain `{password}` placeholder

```
"authentication": {
"type": "phone",
"method": "sms",
"phone": "+1XXXXXXXXX",
"sms_message": "Custom test message with {password}"
}
```

Authentication type: phone Method: phone_call

```
"authentication": {
"type": "phone",
"method": "phone_call",
"phone": "+1XXXXXXXXX"
}
```

Authentication type: password

```
"authentication": {
"type": "password",
"password": "123456"
}
```

**Name_formula parameter**

User can create Document name that will be generated based on selected fields set at the `name_formula` parameter after document completed.

The embedded invite has parameter "name_formula" with fields:

`"any_text_prefix|document_field1|document_field2|document_field3|document_field4|document_field5"`.

If `any_text_prefix` set as `Contract`, and the document has only 2 fields (can have up to 5):

- `signer_name` (filled as `John Smith`)
- `signed_date` (filled as 20.01.2023),

the document will have the name

`“Contract John Smith 20.01.2023”`.

api_list.name: [Embedded signing] Upload document
api_list.description:
Uploads a file to user's account and returns unique id of the uploaded document. Accepts `.doc`,  `.docx`,  `.pdf`,  `.xls`,  `.xlsx`,  `.ppt`,  `.pptx` and 
 `.png` file types.

Maximum file size per upload is 50 Mb.

The same limit works for the attachments uploaded by signers via SignNow editor.

api_list.name: Create signing link
api_list.description:
Creates a Signing Link for a specific document.

**Add values of Smart fields to Redirect URI**

In case of creating a link for a template that contains smart fields, there is an option to add smart field values via placeholders into the redirect uri.

1. Create a template with Smart fields
2. Create a single signing link for the template with `redirect_uri` parameter that contains field placeholders to match field values.

*Example*

```
https://example.com?firstname=[smart_fields.firstname]&lastname=[smart_fields.lastname]
```
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://signnowapi-signnow.p.rapidapi.com/link"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "signnowapi-signnow.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://signnowapi-signnow.p.rapidapi.com/link"

print(response.json())

api_list.name: Send a free form invite
api_list.description: Creates and sends a free form invite to sign a document. The endpoint sends the document without fields.

 `.png` file types.

Maximum file size per upload is 50 Mb.

The same limit works for the attachments uploaded by signers via SignNow editor.

api_list.name: [Free form invite] Authentication
api_list.description: Returns an access token for a user.

optional_parameters.name: expiration_time
optional_parameters.description:
the amount of time till the token expires in seconds;  
if “null”,  the token will be expired.

api_list.name: Field invite
api_list.description: Creates and sends a field invite to sign a document. **Field invite** sends the document which contains fields and has to be filled out and signed in a specific order.

api_list.name: Authentication
api_list.description: Returns an access token for a user.

optional_parameters.name: expiration_time
optional_parameters.description:
the amount of time till the token expires in seconds;  
if “null”,  the token will be expired.

api_list.name: Make template from document
api_list.description:
Creates a template by flattening an existing document.

**Template** - an entity that holds the structure of a document and serves for generating its copies.

signNow users cannot make a template without uploading a document first. They can generate (clone) a new instance of a document from it.

When you create an invite using a template, recipients sign the instance of this template - a document. The instance can be customized specifically for the recipient, for example, prefilled with the account info. Templates can be shared within a team and edited only by the owner.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://signnowapi-signnow.p.rapidapi.com/template"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "signnowapi-signnow.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://signnowapi-signnow.p.rapidapi.com/template"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",

        }

print(response.json())

api_list.name: Make document from template
api_list.description: Creates a new document copy out of template. If a name is not supplied than it will default to the original template name.
